text: The 1966 San Francisco Giants season was the Giants' 84th year in Major League Baseball, their ninth year in San Francisco since their move from New York following the 1957 season, and their seventh at Candlestick Park. The Giants finished second in the National League with a record of 93 wins and 68 losses, a game-and-a-half behind their arch-rivals, the NL champion Los Angeles Dodgers. == Offseason == * October 15, 1965: Warren Spahn was released by the Giants.Warren Spahn at Baseball Reference * December 2, 1965: Randy Hundley and Bill Hands traded to the Chicago Cubs for Lindy McDaniel and Don Landrum.Randy Hundley Trades and Transactions at Baseball Almanac == Regular season == === Season standings === === Record vs. opponents === === Opening Day lineup === *Jesús Alou *Tito Fuentes *Len Gabrielson *Tom Haller *Jim Ray Hart *Hal Lanier *Juan Marichal *Willie Mays *Willie McCoveyhttp://www.baseball-almanac.com/teamstats/roster.php?y=1966&t;=SFN === Notable transactions === * May 8, 1966: Orlando Cepeda was traded by the Giants to the St. Louis Cardinals for Ray Sadecki.Orlando Cepeda at Baseball- Reference * June 10, 1966: Bob Shaw was purchased from the Giants by the New York Mets.Mets buy Bob Shaw from Giants ==Game log and schedule== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !colspan="2"|Legend |- | style="background:#bfb;"| ||Giants win |- | style="background:#fbb;"| ||Giants loss |- | style="background:#bbb;"| ||Postponement |- |Bold||Giants team member |} {| class="toccolours" style="width:101%; clear:both; margin:1.5em auto; text-align:center;" |- !
